Basilica of Sacr ur de Montmartre 巴士底 烟火 表演 The French Revolution was period of profound social and political upheaval in France that lasted from to It was marked by radical changes in government the rise of nationalism and the spread of revolutionary ideasThe revolution began in with the convening of the Estates General representative assembly comprising the clergy nobility and commoners Dissatisfaction with the monarchy economic inequality and widespread poverty fueled popular unrestOn July the storming of the Bastille occurred which symbolized the people rebellion against royal authority This event triggered wave of uprisings and violence throughout France known as the Great Fear as peasants revolted against feudal oppressionIn constitutional monarchy was established but tensions persisted leading to the radicalization of the revolution In France declared war on several European powers and Louis XVI the king was eventually overthrown and executed in January The revolution entered more radical phase with the rise of the Committee of Public Safety and Maximilien Robespierre This period known as the Reign of Terror was characterized by mass executions and the suppression of perceived enemies of the revolutionIn the revolution ended with the rise of Napoleon Bonaparte who staged coup and established the Consulate Napoleon would go on to become Emperor of the French and reshape Europe through series of military campaignsThe French Revolution had profound impact not only on France but also on the world It inspired and influenced subsequent revolutionary movements and played crucial role in the spread of ideas such as liberty equality and fraternity It also led to the abolition of feudalism the secularization of French society and the establishment of new legal and political framework 法国 凡尔赛宫
